heisig_chinese_memo: A silk gauze can be used to filter the dirt off of the edible root of a flower allowing you to eat it. &nbsp

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A silk gauze can be used to filter the dirt off of the edible root of a flower allowing you to eat it.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "艸", " Luo " sound. " Luo " is a cursive name, the same as " E ". "Er Ya. "Shi Cao": "E, Luo." Guo Pu's note: "Today's wormwood is also called Linhao." "Shuowen": "Luo, ye also. Congcha, Luo Sheng."

" Lo " also refers to certain vines, such as sylvestris, usnea, and vines. "Jade articles. "Chabu": "Luo, Nuluo, born in Tuosong." Examples such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Tiao Bian" "Tiao and Nv Luo, applied to pine and cypress." Mao Chuan: "Nv Luo, Dodder, Usnea also." "Selected Works. Guo Jingchun's "Poetry of the Immortals": "The cold dew is blowing on the vetch, and the female Luo speaks of pine and cypress."
humanum_short_description_en: From "艸", " Luo " sound. " Luo " is a cursive name, the same as " E ".
humanum_full_description:
從「艸」，「羅」聲。「蘿」是草名，同「莪」。《爾雅．釋草》：「莪，蘿。」郭璞注：「今莪蒿也，亦曰廪蒿。」《說文》：「蘿，莪也。从艸，羅聲。」

　　「蘿」同表示某些蔓生植物，如女蘿、松蘿、藤蘿等。《玉篇．艸部》：「蘿，女蘿，托松而生。」例子如《詩．小雅．頍弁》「蔦與女蘿，施于松柏。」毛傳：「女蘿，菟絲，松蘿也。」《文選．郭景純〈遊仙詩〉》：「寒露拂陵苕，女蘿辭松柏。」
humanum_short_description: 從「艸」，「羅」聲。「蘿」是草名，同「莪」。

從「 艸 」，「 羅 」聲。「 蘿 」是草名，同「 莪 」。《爾雅．釋草》：「莪，蘿。」郭璞注：「今莪蒿也，亦曰廪蒿。」《說文》：「蘿，莪也。从艸，羅聲。」 「 蘿 」同表示某些蔓生植物，如女蘿、松蘿、藤蘿等。《玉篇．艸部》：「蘿，女蘿，托松而生。」例子如《詩．小雅．頍弁》「蔦與女蘿，施于松柏。」毛傳：「女蘿，菟絲，松蘿也。」《文選．郭景純〈遊仙詩〉》：「寒露拂陵苕，女蘿辭松柏。」
From " 艸", " Luo" sound. " Luo" is a cursive name, the same as " E". "Er Ya. "Shi Cao": "E, Luo." Guo Pu's note: "Today's wormwood is also called Linhao." "Shuowen": "Luo, ye also. Congcha, Luo Sheng." " Lo" also refers to certain vines, such as sylvestris, usnea, and vines. "Jade articles. "Chabu": "Luo, Nuluo, born in Tuosong." Examples such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Tiao Bian" "Tiao and Nv Luo, applied to pine and cypress." Mao Chuan: "Nv Luo, Dodder, Usnea also." "Selected Works. Guo Jingchun's "Poetry of the Immortals": "The cold dew is blowing on the vetch, and the female Luo speaks of pine and cypress."

蘿字的基本解释

蘿
luó
见“萝”。

蘿字的汉语字典释义

[①]［luó］
［《廣韻》魯何切，平歌，來。］
“萝1”的繁体字。
指松萝，或云女萝。蔓生植物。色青灰，缘松柏或其他乔木而生，亦间有寄生石上者，枝体下垂如丝状。

蘿字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　蘿； 康熙笔画：25； 页码：页1071第37
【唐韻】魯何切【正韻】郞何切，?音羅。【玉篇】女蘿託松而生。【詩·小雅】蔦與女蘿，施于松柏。【傳】女蘿，兔絲，松蘿也。【疏】松蘿，自蔓松上生，枝正靑，與兔絲殊異。【韻會】陸佃云：在木爲女蘿，在草爲兔絲。【屈原·離騷】被薜茘兮帶女蘿。　又【說文】莪也。【爾雅·釋草】莪蘿【註】今莪蒿也。　又【爾雅·釋草】葖蘆萉【疏】今謂之蘿蔔。　又苧蘿，山名。見苧字註。

蘿字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
蘿字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
radish
luó
See "Luo".
radish
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［luó］
["Guangyun" Lu Heqie, Ping Ge, come. ]
Traditional characters for "罗1".
Refers to Usnea, or Yunnuluo. Trailing plants. The color is blue and gray, and it grows from pines and cypresses or other trees. There are also parasitic rocks, and the branches hang down like silk.
radish
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Jian Zi] 　 Luo; Kangxi Strokes: 25; Page Number: Page 1071 Page 37
[Tang Yun] Lu He Qi [Zheng Yun] Yin He Qi,? Yin Luo. [Jade articles] Female Luo Tuosong was born. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】Tatsuta and Nuluo, applied to pine and cypress. [Biography] Nuluo, Rabbit Silk, Usnea also. [Sparse] Usnea, which grows from vine pine, has straight branches and is different from rabbit silk. [Rhyme Club] Lu Dianyun: In the wood, it is the female radish, and in the grass it is the rabbit silk. [Qu Yuan·Lisao] She was taken by the female Luo Mixi.　[Said the text] Ye also. 【Erya·Shucao】Eluo 【Note】Eye Artemisia is also today.　[Erya·Shucao] Linlu [Sparse] Nowadays, it is called radish.　Yuan Luo, the name of the mountain. See note on the word ram.
